name: Evaluate Box
description: Evaluate a box in normalised {UVW} space.

inputs.name: U parameter
inputs.description: {u} parameter (values between 0.0 and 1.0 are inside the box)

inputs.name: V parameter
inputs.description: {v} parameter (values between 0.0 and 1.0 are inside the box)

inputs.name: W parameter
inputs.description: {w} parameter (values between 0.0 and 1.0 are inside the box)

outputs.name: Include
outputs.description: True if point is inside or on box

description: Get the control-points of a Nurbs Surface

outputs.name: U Count
outputs.description: Number of points along U direction

outputs.name: V Count
outputs.description: Number of points along V direction

name: SubD Fuse
description: Combine 2 SubD objects

inputs.name: SubD A
inputs.description: First SubD or Mesh object to be fused

inputs.name: SubD B
inputs.description: Second SubD or Mesh object to be fused

inputs.name: Smoothing
inputs.description: Number of smoothing steps to perform on the join

name: Center Box
description: Create a box centered on a plane.

name: Box 2Pt
description: Create a box defined by two points.

name: Shape In Brep
description: Tests whether a shape is inside a brep

inputs.name: Geometry
inputs.description: Brep, mesh or planar closed curve for area computation

description: Generate a grid of {uv} frames on a surface

description: Create a loft fitted through a set of curves.

inputs.name: Count U
inputs.description: Number of points along curve direction

name: Evaluate Surface
description: Evaluate local surface properties at a {uv} coordinate.

name: Edge Surface
description: Create a surface from two, three or four edge curves.

name: Quad Sphere
description: Create a spherical brep made from quad nurbs patches.

name: Extrude Along
description: Extrude curves and surfaces along a curve.

name: Principal Curvature
description: Evaluate the principal curvature of a surface at a {uv} coordinate.

outputs.name: Max direction
outputs.description: Principal curvature direction corresponding to C¹.

outputs.name: Min direction
outputs.description: Principal curvature direction corresponding to C².

name: Surface Curvature
description: Evaluate the surface curvature at a {uv} coordinate.

name: Plane Surface
description: Create a plane surface

name: Loft Options
description: Create loft options from atomic inputs

name: Surface Closest Point
description: Find the closest point on a surface.

outputs.name: Distance
outputs.description: Distance between sample point and surface

name: Surface From Points
description: Create a nurbs surface from a grid of points.

description: Solve volume properties for closed breps and meshes.

inputs.name: Geometry
inputs.description: Closed brep or mesh for volume computation

outputs.name: Inertia
outputs.description: Moments of inertia around the centroid

outputs.name: Secondary
outputs.description: Secondary moments of inertia around the centroid

name: Fillet Edge
description: Fillet some edges of a brep.

name: Brep Closest Point
description: Find the closest point on a brep

outputs.name: Distance
outputs.description: Distance between sample point and Brep

name: MultiPipe
description: Create a branching pipe around a network of lines/curves

inputs.name: Curves
inputs.description: The curves to pipe. Also accepts meshes

inputs.name: NodeSize
inputs.description: Pipe radius. If one value given, it is applied to all. Alternatively, provide a list of radii corresponding to each point in SizePoints

inputs.name: SizePoints
inputs.description: If you are supplying multiple radii for NodeSize, these points identify which node to set as which radius. If only some of the nodes have their radius set this way, the values will be interpolated across the shape

inputs.name: EndOffset
inputs.description: The distance of the first edge loop away from the node as a multiplier of NodeSize. If this is set to zero, no intermediate edge loop is added, to give a smoother shape.

inputs.name: StrutSize
inputs.description: The size of the struts between nodes as a multiplier of NodeSize. <1 gives tapering struts, >1 gives bulging struts

inputs.name: Segment
inputs.description: Approximate spacing of edge loops along each strut. If set to zero, no additional edge loops are added

inputs.name: KinkAngle
inputs.description: When the input to 'Curves' are smooth curves, this sets the maximum angle between consecutive segments when discretizing

inputs.name: CubeFit
inputs.description: If >0 this attempts to fit a cube at each node. Should be a value between 0 and 1, where 0 = never, and 1 = always, depending on how close to orthogonal its connected lines are.

name: Divide Surface
description: Generate a grid of {uv} points on a surface.

name: Patch
description: Create a patch surface

name: Surface Frames [OBSOLETE]
description: Generate a grid of {uv} frames on a surface

name: Control Point Loft
description: Create a loft through curve control points.

name: Copy Trim
description: Copy UV trim data from one surface to another.

name: Brep Area Moments
description: Solve Brep area moments.

outputs.name: Inertia
outputs.description: Moments of inertia around the centroid

outputs.name: Secondary
outputs.description: Secondary moments of inertia around the centroid

name: Sum Surface
description: Create a sum surface from two edge curves.

name: Edges from Directions
description: Select brep edges based on edge direction

inputs.name: Reflex
inputs.description: If true, angle test includes the reflex angle

name: Isotrim
description: Extract an isoparametric subset of a surface.

name: Bounding Box
description: Solve world oriented geometry bounding boxes.

inputs.name: Union
inputs.description: Create a single unified box for all objects

name: Ruled Surface
description: Create a surface between two curves.

outputs.name: Surface
outputs.description: Ruled surface between A and B

name: Closed Edges
description: Select closed edges.

inputs.name: Tangency
inputs.description: If true, consecutive tangent edges will be taken into account.

name: Network Surface
description: Create a surface from curve networks

name: Edges from Faces
description: Select all brep edges that delineate certain faces

name: Edges from Points
description: Select brep edges based on point coincidence

inputs.name: Valence
inputs.description: Minimum valence of points per edge

name: Sweep2
description: Create a sweep surface with two rail curves.

inputs.name: Same Height
inputs.description: Create a sweep with same-height properties.

name: Domain Box
description: Create a box defined by a base plane and size domains.

inputs.name: X
inputs.description: Domain of the box in the {x} direction.

inputs.name: Y
inputs.description: Domain of the box in the {y} direction.

inputs.name: Z
inputs.description: Domain of the box in the {z} direction.

name: Convex Edges
description: Select concave or convex brep edges.

name: SubD Faces
description: Extract all face data from a SubD.

outputs.name: Count
outputs.description: Number of edges (and vertices) which surround this face.

name: SubD from Mesh
description: Create a SubD from a control mesh

name: Point In Breps
description: Test whether a point is inside a collection of closed breps

inputs.name: Strict
inputs.description: If true, then the inclusion is strict

outputs.name: Inside
outputs.description: True if point is on the inside at least one of the Breps.

outputs.name: Index
outputs.description: Index of first brep that contains the point, or -1

name: Brep Topology
description: Get and display the topology of a brep.

outputs.name: Face|Face Adjacency
outputs.description: For each face lists all faces that surround it.

outputs.name: Face|Edge Adjacency
outputs.description: For each face lists all edges that surround it.

outputs.name: Edge|Face Adjacency
outputs.description: for each edge lists all faces that surround it.

name: Bounding Box
description: Solve oriented geometry bounding boxes.

inputs.description: Create a single unified box for all objects

outputs.name: Box

outputs.name: Box

name: Pipe Variable
description: Create a pipe surface with variable radii around a rail curve.

inputs.name: Radii
inputs.description: A list of radii for every defined parameter

name: Deconstruct Brep
description: Deconstruct a brep into its constituent parts.

name: Extrude Linear
description: Extrude curves and surfaces along a straight path.

inputs.name: Orientation (P)
inputs.description: Plane indicating orientation of profile shape

inputs.name: Orientation (A)
inputs.description: Optional orientational plane for the axis

name: SubD Vertex Tags
description: Set the vertex tags of a SubD shape.

inputs.description: Vertex tag descriptor. (S=smooth, C=crease, L=corner, D=dart)

name: Extrude
description: Extrude curves and surfaces along a vector.

description: Create a box defined by two points.

description: Solve world oriented geometry bounding boxes.

description: Extract all 8 corners of a box.

description: Create a lofted surface through a set of section curves.

description: Evaluate local surface properties at a {uv} coordinate.

description: Solve Brep area properties.

name: Brep Wireframe
description: Extract the wireframe curves of a brep.

name: Extrude Angled
description: Extrude a planar polyline at angles

name: Box Properties
description: Get some properties of a box

name: Sphere 4Pt
description: Create a spherical surface from 4 points.

inputs.name: Point 2
inputs.description: Second point (cannot be coincident with P1)

inputs.name: Point 3
inputs.description: Third point (cannot be colinear with P1 & P2)

inputs.name: Point 4
inputs.description: Fourth point (cannot be coplanar with P1, P2 & P3)

name: Offset Surface
description: Offset a surface by a fixed amount.

name: Cap Holes
description: Cap all planar holes in a Brep.

description: Calculate the principal osculating circles of a surface at a {uv} coordinate.

name: Sweep1
description: Create a sweep surface with one rail curve.

description: Extrude curves and surfaces to a point.

description: Get the approximation mesh of a SubD.

description: Extract the control polygon from a SubD.

description: Create a pipe surface around a rail curve.

name: Flip
description: Flip the normals of a surface based on local or remote geometry

outputs.name: Result
outputs.description: Result: True if surface was flipped

name: Brep Volume
description: Solve Brep volume properties.

name: 4Point Surface
description: Create a surface connecting three or four corner points.

description: Create a box defined by a rectangle and a height.

description: Merge all adjacent co-planar faces in a brep

description: Make a rectangular surface that is larger than a given shape.

name: Rail Revolution
description: Create a surface of revolution using a sweep rail.

name: Sphere
description: Create a spherical surface.

description: Deconstruct a box into its constituent parts.

description: Test whether a point is inside a closed brep

inputs.name: Strict

inputs.name: NodeSize
inputs.description: Pipe radius. If one value given, it is applied to all. Alternatively, provide a list of radii corresponding to each point in SizePoints

inputs.name: SizePoints
inputs.description: If you are supplying multiple radii for NodeSize, these points identify which node to set as which radius. If only some of the nodes have their radius set this way, the values will be interpolated across the shape

inputs.name: EndOffset
inputs.description: The distance of the first edge loop away from the node as a multiplier of NodeSize. If this is set to zero, no intermediate edge loop is added, to give a smoother shape.

inputs.name: StrutSize
inputs.description: The size of the struts between nodes as a multiplier of NodeSize. <1 gives tapering struts, >1 gives bulging struts

inputs.name: Segment
inputs.description: Approximate spacing of edge loops along each strut. If set to zero, no additional edge loops are added

inputs.description: When the input to 'Curves' are smooth curves, this sets the maximum angle between consecutive segments when discretizing

inputs.name: CubeFit
inputs.description: If >0 this attempts to fit a cube at each node. Should be a value between 0 and 1, where 0 = never, and 1 = always, depending on how close to orthogonal its connected lines are.
